page.title: 15LEIGH CHURCH
page.content:
{ LEIGH CHURCH AND LEIGH COURT
The exterior of St. Edburga's church has some noteworthy features, including the porch at the west door, which was probably originally on the south wall. There is a sundial on the south wall of the tower, which is reputed to be very accurate, while in the churchyard there is a Saxon Preaching Cross. In the Middle Ages the church lay under the authority of the Abbots of Pershore, who also owned the Manor of Leigh. The original Manor House was adjacent to the church and passed into private hands after the dissolution of the monasteries. The present house, Leigh Court, is on the same site but of much later construction.
